name: 2024 Riva Ranch Chardonnay
description: This lush Chardonnay has plenty of character and is loaded with perfectly ripened apples, caramelized pineapple, and toasted brioche. The optimally ripened fruit is complemented by a tasteful measure of slightly creamy oak that hints at notes of crème brulée, along with a dollop of buttery richness that lasts well into the lengthy finish.

name: 2022 Livermore Valley Wetmore Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Opens with aromas of black currant and cassis, complemented by a hint of 'Livermore Dust.' Creamy oak notes bring roasted cocoa nibs and hardwood complexity. On the palate, the wine offers layers of ripe black cherry and plum, leading to a long, satisfying finish with a firm tannin structure.

name: 2022 Cabernet Franc
description: Small lot wine harvested from carefully selected blocks that are estate-grown and sustainably farmed. With an east-west valley orientation, the site gets warm days and cool nights that are influenced by fog and breezes from the San Francisco Bay and Pacific Ocean. The grapes are handpicked and sorted at harvest time to ensure premium quality.

name: 2024 Riva Ranch Riesling
description: Bursts with lively fruit character and delicate floral aromatics. Fragrant notes of honeysuckle and orange blossom lead the bouquet, layered with juicy white peach, apricot, and a touch of honeyed richness. On the palate, crisp pear and apple introduce a subtle sweetness at the core, balanced beautifully by a refreshing lift of acidity.

name: 2024 Morning Fog Chardonnay
description: The cornerstone of the Wente Chardonnay portfolio. Subtle oak nuances of sweet cream and vanilla integrate effortlessly with the bright character of crisp Gala apple, underpinned by hints of fresh-cut pear and lemon curd. Offers the hallmark weight and depth of classic Chardonnay, balanced by a refined acidity.

name: Brut Sparkling Wine
description: A classic Brut with aromas and flavors of pear and dried apricot with hints of crème brulée and apple. Nice complexity from the sur lies aging in the Méthode Champenoise, with a refreshing crispness and lingering vanilla cream aftertaste that pairs exceptionally well with food.

name: 2023 Aly's Pinot Noir
description: Crafted to showcase the Arroyo Seco AVA terroir. The wine has expressive aromas of cherry, cranberry, rose petal, forest floor and cinnamon. Bright flavors of red cherry and vanilla are rounded out beautifully.

name: 2024 Niki's Rosé
description: Opens with aromatics of melon, strawberry and rose petal. Delivers on the palate tropical flavors of mango and passion fruit with a complexing touch of minerality. The wine finishes with mouth watering acidity that makes it perfect for food pairing or a hot summer day.

name: 2024 Eric's Chardonnay
description: Unoaked to exemplify the beautiful varietal character of Livermore Valley Chardonnay. Bursting with aromas of citrus, melon, and white flowers. The wine has bright flavors of honeydew and Meyer lemon with a touch of minerality.

name: 2024 Sauvignon Blanc
description: Beautiful aromatics of green melon and passion fruit framed by subtle sweet oak. Flavors of ripe grapefruit and honeydew backed by bright acidity.

name: 2021 Meritage
description: Shows the balanced depth and richness that Bordeaux style blends bring to the table. The nose opens with red and black cherries, anise and currants framed by warm baking spice and vanilla bean French oak notes. The rich and full entry on the palate gives way to supple lingering tannins.

name: 2024 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc
description: Classic fruit combined with juicy acidity which adds up to a wine bursting with youthful exuberance. Notes of classic grapefruit with additional notes of white apricot, guava, and key lime. Complemented by fruit-driven flavors of sweet Meyer lemon and candied citrus. Well rounded with a balanced acidity and a touch of minerality on the finish.

name: 2024 Pacific Mist Pinot Grigio
description: Breezy coastal influences from the Pacific Ocean shape this vibrant and refreshing Pinot Grigio. Delicate floral aromatics lead to a lively palate bursting with crisp green apple, zesty grapefruit, and a bright citrus core. A beautifully balanced acidity lends a mouthwatering quality.

name: 2023 Limited Release Chardonnay
description: Meticulously crafted from estate-grown, certified sustainable vineyards and partially aged in French oak barrels. Vibrant notes of green apple, citrus, and subtle vanilla, presenting a refined balance of freshness and complexity.

name: 2020 nth DEGREE Cabernet Sauvignon
description: A selection of handcrafted, limited production wines created by Fifth Generation Winemaker, Karl D. Wente. The focus is to create wines that reflect the distinctive terroir of the Wente family's estate vineyards. Each wine must show style and finesse of stellar degree to be included in the nth DEGREE program. 98 point rating.

name: 2023 nth DEGREE Cabernet Franc
description: The inaugural 2023 vintage is a compelling expression of why this variety thrives in the Livermore Valley. The nose entices with layered aromas of red and black cherry, earthy undertones, black pepper, and a touch of spicy French oak. Rich yet balanced mouthfeel with a refined tannin structure that carries gracefully through a long, elegant finish.

name: 2021 nth DEGREE Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Handcrafted, limited production wine created by Fifth Generation Winemaker, Karl D. Wente. Reflects the distinctive terroir of the Wente family's estate vineyards in Livermore Valley. Only the best of the best achieve this distinction.

name: 2022 nth DEGREE Merlot
description: Aromatics of candied red cherry and a touch of blueberry jam, a sweet and fruity profile, while notes of cocoa and baked cinnamon add layers of complexity and warmth. A full body wine with substantial mouth feel that finishes with big silky tannins. 95 point rating.

name: 2021 nth DEGREE Merlot
description: Aromatics of candied red cherry and a touch of blueberry jam, a sweet and fruity profile, while notes of cocoa and baked cinnamon add layers of complexity and warmth. A full body wine with substantial mouth feel that finishes with big silky tannins.

name: 2023 nth DEGREE Pinot Noir
description: Demonstrates the depth of the Dijon Clone. Dark ruby in the glass, the wine smells of black cherry and blackberries framed by vanilla and toasted oak. Flavors of ripe dark fruits and baking spices are followed by silky tannins.

name: 2022 nth DEGREE Syrah
description: Leads with a mix of ripe plum and smoked meat aromas that are framed by clove and roasted coffee. Flavors are reminiscent of black raspberry, white pepper, and toasted vanilla. Rich and full-bodied, showcasing a velvety roundness and lingering plush tannins.

name: 2022 Duetto
description: Offers depth and elegance, with aromas of pomegranate and black currant, complemented by oak spices, espresso, and cocoa. Well-balanced with fine tannins and mid-palate richness, ideal for aging and food pairings. Double Gold winner.

name: 2021 Duetto Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Exhibits a measure of depth and richness carefully honed by a sense of refinement and elegance. Core aromas of black cherry and red plum are framed by a judicious layering of complex oak spices highlighting notes of fresh ground cinnamon and cocoa powder. 96 point rating.

name: 2022 Sonata
description: An Australian inspired blend of Cabernet and Syrah that impresses with its exotic substance and engaging complexity. Abundant aromas of blackberry and plum fruit form the essence of this elegantly styled wine. Complimentary oak spices of fresh vanilla bean with a hint of glazed caramel.

name: 2021 Sonata
description: An Australian inspired blend of Cabernet and Syrah that impresses with its exotic substance and engaging complexity. Abundant aromas of blackberry and plum fruit form the essence of this elegantly styled wine. Bright acidity and youthful tannins.

name: 2022 GSM
description: Opens with aromas of cherry sauce, plum, smoked meat and brown sugar. Flavors hit all of the markers for a Rhône style blend offering continuous fruit with a subtle bit of white pepper and earth on the finish. The palate is bright and finishes with fine grained tannins.

name: 2021 GSM
description: Rides the line between bright Grenache and savory Syrah with a hint of Mourvèdre. Gold award winner.

name: 2022 Serenity
description: An expressive and enjoyable wine, distinguished by its lively and well-integrated fruit and spice notes. Rhône-inspired palate marked by a harmonious blend of ripe plum and pepper, underscored by a subtle black tea nuance. The bright tannins from Petite Sirah add structure and elegance.

name: 2021 Serenity
description: A proprietary blend of Syrah, Petite Sirah, Grenache, and Mourvèdre that impresses with its exotic substance, riveting depth, and engaging complexity. Plenty of sweet oak showcases baked cinnamon and vanilla bean which perfectly compliments the abundant candied red cherry and dried fruit flavors. Double Gold winner.

name: 2020 Serenity
description: Showcases plenty presence of rich, sweet oak including baked cinnamon and vanilla bean. These notes perfectly compliment the abundant blackberry and plum fruit flavors. A hint of black tea and white pepper that never lets you forget that Syrah is the core of this beautiful blend.

name: 2021 Cabernet Franc
description: Wonderfully layered with aromas of red cherry, baked cinnamon and molasses. Ripe red cherry continues to form the core of this wine's flavor profile along with a touch of olive and warm vanilla oak. Medium bodied, polished and refined to such a degree that it is eminently attractive right now but should age beautifully for the next seven years.

name: 2020 Meritage
description: Shows the balanced depth and richness that Bordeaux style blends bring to the table. Rich, creamy French Oak blends with the layers of cinnamon, cardamom, and raw vanilla bean. Matched equally by a generous concentration of fully ripened black currants, juicy black cherries, and rich plum jam.

name: 2021 Zinfandel
description: Full of sweet oak flavors that play a significant role in the wine's character but not one that overshadows its deep and generous fruit profile. Dark chocolate, nutmeg, and dried fig are prominent in the aroma profile alongside rich and expressive Zinfandel fruit. Jammy boysenberry and ripe plum form the core of the palate with supporting notes of black pepper and spice.

name: 2022 Zinfandel
description: Full of ripe plum, black pepper, warm vanilla and dark chocolate. Jammy blackberry and fig form the core of the palate along with supporting notes of black pepper and spice. Deeply filled with vibrant acidity and a firm spine of tannins.

name: 2022 Baily Hill Pinot Noir
description: A bright and fruit forward example of cool coastal growing. Offers up youthful aromas of Bing cherries and ripe strawberries seamlessly combined with a delicate layer of dark soils, sage, and smoked nuts. Supple and silky tannins combined with modest acidity keep the wine in perfect balance.

name: 2022 Beyer Ranch Zinfandel
description: Encompasses all of the traits that Zinfandel lovers crave. Deep and concentrated blackberry aromas are complemented by layered notes of spice, briar, and notable rich, creamy oak.

name: 2022 Mount Diablo Highlands Red Blend
description: A testament to the winemaking expertise that defines the Wente legacy. A harmonious blend of varieties that the family has cultivated over five generations on the Central Coast of California.

name: 2024 Riverbank Riesling
description: A refreshing Riesling from the cool-climate Arroyo Seco appellation, showcasing the signature crisp acidity and stone fruit character of the region.

name: 2022 Sandstone Merlot
description: Supple and beautifully balanced, showcasing aromas of ripe red cherry and plum that are complemented by creamy oak notes of sweet caramel and vanilla bean. Additional notes of white pepper, cardamom, and graphite provide more complexity.

name: 2022 Southern Hills Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Named for vineyards located along the southern hills of the Central Coast. The Wente family farms approximately 400 acres of Cabernet Sauvignon vineyards using clones originating from Charles Wetmore's Bordeaux cuttings in the 19th century. With well-drained rocky soils and unique microclimates, the Southern Hills vineyards produce Cabernet of distinct character, depth, and intensity.
